intro: Primula fauriei, commonly known as the Chinese primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy, ovate leaves arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding vibrant color to gardens and natural landscapes.
